title: Windows 98 Updates
description:
Contents of the ReadMe file:


Notes about files organized by what directory they are in:

========================================================================
 Directory of \Win98.Upd

Control Panel.{21ec2020-3aea-1069-a2dd-08002b30309d}
Copy this item, and past it in C:\Windows\Start Menu.
This will give you a cascading menu of the contents of the Control Panel.

SprintBBD_regedit95-98.reg
For high-speed internet connections. Alters the value for DefaultRcvWindow to 49152. HUGE speed increase when I was on Sprint Broadband. Do a speed test, merge the reg info, reboot, and test again.

SprintBBD_RestReg95_98.reg
This one will restore the default value for DefaultRcvWindow to 8192

EditPad as HTML Editor.reg
This one causes Editpad (available from www.jgsoft.com) to be the default HTML editor. A great text editor, tabbed interface, colors, fonts selectable, free :). Just merge the REG file to use.

Notepad as HTML Editor.reg
Restore Notepad as HTML editor. Just merge the REG file to use.

pinball.inf
Used to install the Space Cadet Pinball game from the Win95 Plus! CDROM. To use, open the INF file, and modify the following line:

layoutfile = root_of_cdrom:\pluslayt.inf ;change this path to point to the root of the CD-ROM drive

Change &#039;root_of_cdrom&#039; to a letter (if your CD-ROM is drive D, put in a D .. etc.)
For instance :
layoutfile = R:\pluslayt.inf ;change this path to point to the root of the CD-ROM drive
Now, right-click the INF file and select Install.



========================================================================
 Directory of \Win98.Upd\Bootup Logo Screens

These files are a replacement for the Win98 bootup logo. THey are BMP files of an specific size, then resizes to an odd size, and then the extention changed to .SYS. You can make your own too, from any BMP file. Instructions for each are included in each ZIP file.

0001coke.zip
0003firewks.zip
0011brokenwin.zip
0018ieplus.zip
0035win666.zip
00393dwin97.zip
0050winter98.zip
0109stlogin.zip
0124stlogo2.zip
0136q2frag.zip
0155staccess.zip
0158stlog2.zip
0163starflt.zip
0182winborg.zip
0182winborg2.zip
0219aliencamp.zip
0220scifivortex.zip
0237calvinhobbes.zip
0251thematrix.zip
0254ufplogo.zip
0262marvinsfamousquote.zip
0279ruready.zip
0282c64loader.zip
0302billgatus.zip
0327whatisthematrixwindows9x.zip



========================================================================
 Directory of \Win98.Upd\ICS Client Disk

This is a utility to create an Internet Connection Sharing client setup disk. The ics_readme has details on how to use.

icsclset.exe
ics_ReadMe.txt



========================================================================

 Directory of \Win98.Upd\PowerToys

These are utilities that add some neat functionality. Expand each one, and a readme from M$ is included inside. The 2 &#039;powertoys&#039; items contain many different things, and the 2 &#039;tweakUI&#039; items are only 2 versions of the TweakUI utility, which is one of the utilities included in each of the Powertoys packages (of course, versions are different in the packages).

Tweakui2k.ZIP
tweakui_133.exe
Win95 powertoys.exe
Win98 Powertoys.zip



========================================================================
 Directory of \Win98.Upd\VB Runtime

Visual Basic Runtime setup utilities. Gathered these as they were needed over the years, so that I had them available when an installed program complained that they were not installed. These are not required for Win95/98/ME to function, but some apps and utils require versions of the VBR that do not come standard in Windows. Readme included in each package (if I recall correctly).

Vb4Run.exe
vbrun60sp3.EXE
vbrun60sp5.exe
